meanings.definition: To clothe or adorn oneself again.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the rain, the children enjoyed revesting in their warm pajamas.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, she takes pleasure in revesting in her favorite dress.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be revesting in its fur after grooming itself for hours.
meanings.sent4: The garden was revesting in colorful flowers after the long winter.
meanings.sent5: The old house was revesting in new paint, looking fresh and bright.

meanings.definition: To invest again with a title or office.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to revest his loyal advisor with the title of Duke.
meanings.sent2: The company board voted to revest the CEO with full authority over the new project.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly revested the rabbit with the title of 'Chief Carrot Officer'.
meanings.sent4: The teacher revested the student with the responsibility of class monitor.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was revesting with the power to fly, ready to save the day once more.
